comments.raw_text:
I'd wanted to see what was happening in IM when we bailed, and (at least on arm), the bailout stack does not give any easy way to determine exactly what code was executing before the bailout was taken.
With this patch, we'll optionally emit a trap instruction rather than a branch to the bailout.
This means that while running in gdb, bailing out will immediately transfer control to the debugger, and allow us to investigate the process.
